docs.lead_paragraph: N.F.L. owners, players and league executives, about 30 in all, convened urgently at the league’s headquarters on Park Avenue in October, nearly a month after President Trump began deriding the league and its players over protests during the national anthem.

headline.main: Inside the Confidential N.F.L. Meeting to Discuss National Anthem Protests
headline.print_headline: Candid Audio As N.F.L. Met Over Protests

docs.abstract: We fact checked what Facebook’s chief executive is telling lawmakers in congressional hearings about the social network’s responsibilities to users and more.
docs.snippet: We fact checked what Facebook’s chief executive is telling lawmakers in congressional hearings about the social network’s responsibilities to users and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s chief executive, is testifying before Congress on Tuesday and Wednesday to answer questions about the social network’s failure to protect the data of millions of its users and its role in Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.

headline.main: Fact Check: What Mark Zuckerberg Said About Facebook, Privacy and Russia

docs.lead_paragraph: A Facebook page that claimed a connection to the Black Lives Matter movement and had more than twice as many followers as the movement’s official page has been removed for being inauthentic, the company said.

headline.main: Facebook Removes Popular Black Lives Matter Page for Being a Fake
headline.print_headline: Facing Questions in Congress, Facebook Shuts Down Fake Page

docs.abstract: Dr. King said in 1957 that democracy was failing to live up to its “noble ideals and principles.” That remains true today.
docs.snippet: Dr. King said in 1957 that democracy was failing to live up to its “noble ideals and principles.” That remains true today.
docs.lead_paragraph: My brother and I shared a bedroom during our youth, and our mornings typically began with my mother’s voice signaling the start of a new day. Except for one morning in April 1968, when she sat at the edge of my bed and gently shook me out of my slumber.

headline.main: The Politically Progressive Faith of Martin Luther King

docs.abstract: We owe it to Dr. King to commemorate the man in full: a radical, ecumenical, antiwar, pro-immigrant and scholarly champion of the poor.
docs.snippet: We owe it to Dr. King to commemorate the man in full: a radical, ecumenical, antiwar, pro-immigrant and scholarly champion of the poor.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the nation prepares to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., we should dwell not merely on how Dr. King died but also on how he lived.

headline.main: Jesse Jackson: How Dr. King Lived Is Why He Died
headline.print_headline: How King Lived Is Why He Died

docs.abstract: Fifty years after King’s assassination, three television documentaries explore his impact on the nightly news, and King’s more disillusioned final years.
docs.snippet: Fifty years after King’s assassination, three television documentaries explore his impact on the nightly news, and King’s more disillusioned final years.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., more than most civil rights leaders, understood the singular role that television played in documenting the brutality of racial violence on African-Americans and eliciting sympathy from white viewers. As three new television documentaries marking the 50th anniversary of his assassination show, King embraced prime time news television coverage as a matter of political strategy and survival through his savvy use of sound bites, well-timed protests and the practice of nonviolence in the face of abuse.

headline.main: Seeing Martin Luther King Jr. in a New Light
headline.print_headline: Marching Against the Glare of the Nightly News

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Hope & Fury: MLK, the Movement and the Media (TV Program)

docs.lead_paragraph: BERRYVILLE, Va. — For more than a month now, the questions have ricocheted down this Main Street culled from a Norman Rockwell dreamscape — past the dueling barbershops and the outdoor broom sale and the mural with the horse — quietly at first, when the Florida massacre was still fresh, and then not so quietly.

headline.main: After Gun Control Marches, ‘It’ll Go Away’ vs. ‘We Are Not Cynical Yet’
headline.print_headline: Gun Control and Fall Elections: Moment or Movement?

docs.abstract: Social justice movements like Black Lives Matter and #MeToo embody his critical spirit.
docs.snippet: Social justice movements like Black Lives Matter and #MeToo embody his critical spirit.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — On May 5, 1818, in the southern German town of Trier, in the picturesque wine-growing region of the Moselle Valley, Karl Marx was born. At the time Trier was one-tenth the size it is today, with a population of around 12,000. According to one of Marx’s recent biographers, Jürgen Neffe, Trier is one of those towns where “although everyone doesn’t know everyone, many know a lot about many.”

headline.main: Happy Birthday, Karl Marx. You Were Right!
